thread.title: Installation of Denver Artist Patrick Marold’s Outdoor Sculpture of 236 Beetle-Kill Spruce Logs to Begin at Denver International AirportTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Installation of Denver Artist Patrick Marold’s Outdoor Sculpture of 236 Beetle-Kill Spruce Logs to Begin at Denver International AirportTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Installation of Denver Artist Patrick Marold’s Outdoor Sculpture of 236 Beetle-Kill Spruce Logs to Begin at Denver International AirportTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Installation of Denver Artist Patrick Marold’s Outdoor Sculpture of 236 Beetle-Kill Spruce Logs to Begin at Denver International Airport Published on : Thursday, September 10, 2015
Installation of “Shadow Array,” by Denver sculptor, Patrick Marold, will begin on Thursday, September 10 near the entrance of the upcoming Transit Center at Denver International Airport (DIA). Marold’s artwork features 236 large beetle-kill spruce logs from the Del Norte forest in southern Colorado.
Each log, weighing an average of 2,500 pounds, will be lifted into place by a large crane, then fastened to steel structures, which will hold the logs in place. The final sculpture, expected to be complete in October 2015, will arc around the train platform and create light and shadow patterning as visitors arrive to the transit center.
Source:- Denver International Airport
